The '''Pearl of Great Price''' is part of the [[Standard Works|standard works]] of [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]] (LDS Church; see also [[Mormonism]]) and some other [[Latter Day Saint movement|Latter Day Saint]] denominations.
The first paragraph of the Introductory Note in the LDS edition of the Pearl of Great Price reads:
:The Pearl of Great Price is a selection of choice materials touching many significant aspects of the faith and doctrine of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. These items were produced by Joseph Smith Jr. and were published in the Church periodicals of his day.
==Contents== {{Portal|Latter-day Saints}} The Pearl of Great Price contains five sections: #Selections from the [[Book of Moses]]: Portions of the [[Joseph Smith Translation of the Bible]] (JST), including the teachings and prophecies of [[Enoch (ancestor of Noah)|Enoch]] and his testimony of Jesus Christ. #The [[Book of Abraham]]: The book, which Smith claims to have translated the [[Book of Abraham]] from purchased [[papyrus|papyri]], relates [[Abraham]]'s journeys in Egypt, containing many distinctive [[Mormon]] doctrines such as [[Exaltation (Mormonism)|exaltation]] and the [[plurality of gods]]. Considerable controversy surrounds [[Joseph Smith Papyri|the surviving papyri]] [[Book of Abraham#Origin|claimed as the source for the translation]] of the Book of Abraham. #[[Joseph Smith—Matthew]]: Portions of the [[Joseph Smith Translation of the Bible|JST]] of the [[Gospel of Matthew|Book of Matthew]] #[[Joseph Smith—History]]: A first-person narrative of [[Joseph Smith, Jr.]]'s life before the founding of the Church including an account of the [[First Vision]] and other heavenly visitations. #The [[Articles of Faith (Mormonism)|Articles of Faith]]: A concise listing of thirteen fundamental doctrines of Mormonism composed by Joseph Smith as part of a 1842 [[The Wentworth Letter|letter]] sent to [[John Wentworth (mayor)|"Long" John Wentworth]], editor of the ''[[Chicago Democrat]]''.
The original contents of the book were slightly different, reproducing material found in the [[Doctrine and Covenants]] and a poem entitled "Oh Say What is Truth?" (which is now found in the [[Hymns of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (1985 book)|LDS Church hymnal]]). In 1878 some material from the [[Book of Moses]] was added. The Pearl of Great Price was canonized in 1880. In 1902 the material reproduced in the Doctrine and Covenants was removed. Two other documents, now found as Doctrine and Covenants 137 and 138, were added to the Pearl of Great Price in 1976 and moved to their current location in 1979.
==1851 edition== The Pearl of Great Price was first compiled by [[Franklin D. Richards (Mormon apostle)|Franklin D. Richards]] in [[Liverpool]], England. Some items duplicated text that was already available in the Doctrine and Covenants. It contained the following entries (the placement of the text in today's LDS Church publications is noted in parenthesis):
*Extracts from the Prophecy of [[Enoch (ancestor of Noah)|Enoch]] ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/moses/6.43?lang=eng Moses 6:43–7:69]) *A message from God, given to [[Moses]] ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/moses/1.1-42?lang=eng#primary Moses 1:1–42]) *Untitled ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/moses/2.1-5?lang=eng#primary Moses 2:1–5]; [http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/moses/8.13-30?lang=eng 8:13–30]) *The Book of Abraham including [http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/abr/fac-1?lang=eng Facsimile 1], [http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/abr/fac-2?lang=eng 2] and [http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/abr/fac-3?lang=eng 3] from the Book of Abraham ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/abr?lang=eng Book of Abraham]) *An extract from a [[Joseph Smith Translation of the Bible|Translation]] of the Bible ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/js-m/1?lang=eng Joseph Smith—Matthew]) *A Key to the Revelations of [[John of Patmos|St. John]] ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/77?lang=eng Doctrine and Covenants 77]) *A Revelation and Prophecy ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/87?lang=eng Doctrine and Covenants 87]) *Extracts from the History of Joseph Smith ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/js-h/1?lang=eng Joseph Smith—History]) *From the Doctrine and Covenants of the Church Commandment to the Church concerning baptism ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/20.37,%2071-75?lang=eng#36 Doctrine and Covenants 20:37, 71-75]) *The duties of members after they are received by baptism ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/20.68-69?lang=eng#36 Doctrine and Covenants 20:68-69]) *Method of administering the [[Sacrament (LDS Church)|Sacrament of the Lord's Supper]] ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/20.75-79?lang=eng#36 Doctrine and Covenants 20:75–79]) *The Duties of the [[Elder (Latter Day Saints)|Elders]], [[Priest (Latter Day Saints)|Priests]], [[Teacher (Latter Day Saints)|Teachers]], [[Deacon (Latter Day Saints)|Deacons]], and Members of the Church of Christ ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/20.38-44?lang=eng Doctrine and Covenants 20:38–44]; [http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/107.11?lang=eng# 107:11]; [http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/20.45-59,70,80?lang=eng 20:45–59, 70, 80]) *On [[Priesthood (Latter Day Saints)|Priesthood]] ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/107.1-10,12-20?lang=eng Doctrine and Covenants 107:1–10, 12–20]) *The Calling and Duties of the [[Quorum of the Twelve|Twelve Apostles]] ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/107.23,33?lang=eng Doctrine and Covenants 107:23, 33]) *The Calling and Duties of the [[Seventy (Latter Day Saints)|Seventy]] ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/107.34,93-100?lang=eng Doctrine and Covenants 107:34, 93–100]) *Extract from a revelation given July, 1830 ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/27.5-18?lang=eng Doctrine and Covenants 27:5–18]) *Rise of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/dc-testament/dc/20.1-36?lang=eng Doctrine and Covenants 20:1–36]) *''[[Times and Seasons]]'', vol. III, p. 709 ([http://www.lds.org/scriptures/pgp/a-of-f/1?lang=eng Articles of Faith]) *"Truth" (a poem by [[John Jaques (Mormon)|John Jaques]]) ([http://www.lds.org/churchmusic/detailmusicPlayer/index.html?searchlanguage=1&searchcollection=1&searchseqstart=272&searchsubseqstart=%20&searchseqend=272&searchsubseqend=ZZZ "O Say, What is Truth?"], #272 in [[Hymns of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (1985 book)|LDS Church hymnal]]]
